Familiar.FlavourText: It is recommended to stay as far from these hostile creatures as possible -with the exception of plague dragons, who have a natural immunity to serpenta venom.
Familiar.Name: Acid-Tongue Serpenta

Familiar.FlavourText: These observers cluster around ancient aquatic ruins. They may change color to blend with their surroundings.
Familiar.Name: Abyss Striker

Familiar.FlavourText: While they appear non-threatening, dragons take care not to let this spectral creature pass through them.
Familiar.Name: Aer Phantom

Familiar.FlavourText: A backwards thinking creature.
Familiar.Name: Agol

Familiar.FlavourText: A slarg must keep its skin moist to stay hydrated and avoid suffocation.
Familiar.Name: Algae-Bottom Slarg

Familiar.FlavourText: Dwelling in the waters of the Crystal Pools has left the scales of this fish translucent and hard as a gemstone.
Familiar.Name: Almandine Sturgeon

Familiar.FlavourText: The happiest fox.
Familiar.Name: Alstroemeria Fox

Familiar.FlavourText: This distinctive moth has deep reds and purples running through its leafy wings. It's difficult to classify as purely flora or fauna.
Familiar.Name: Amaranth Moth

Familiar.FlavourText: Sometimes dragon eats fish. Sometimes fish eats dragon.
Familiar.Name: Amber Gulper

Familiar.FlavourText: These avians are always humming. It's incredibly annoying.
Familiar.Name: Amberwing Waveskimmer

Familiar.FlavourText: Warped by unstable energies, these arcane-infused ursidae lose all sense of reason when angered.
Familiar.Name: Amethyst King

Familiar.FlavourText: The constant electrical charge that permeates the warm air of the arid savanna acts as an energy boost to this already spry creature. Catching one is extremely difficult.
Familiar.Name: Ampelope

Familiar.FlavourText: The most crotchety of fungi. As it ages the outer shell becomes crackled and hard as stone.
Familiar.Name: Ancient Fungus

Familiar.FlavourText: A blessing and a curse, donning this armor will increase one's martial abilities, but also one's taste for battle.
Familiar.Name: Animated Armor

Familiar.FlavourText: This peculiar statue wasn't standing there when you last looked, and it certainly wasn't posed in that way either. Don't turn your back. Don't look away.
Familiar.Name: Animated Statue

Familiar.FlavourText: Nekomata sleep with their eye open. It's as disconcerting as it sounds.
Familiar.Name: Anomalous Nekomata

Familiar.FlavourText: Two heads are better than one, except when they're connected to two stomachs. Food fight!
Familiar.Name: Anomalous Skink

Familiar.FlavourText: Ewwww... gross! Yuck! The upholstery is definitely the wrong color.
Familiar.Name: Antique Chair

Familiar.FlavourText: Feasting a diet of crystal-scaled fish has had a dramatic effect on the plumage of this crane.
Familiar.Name: Apatite Fisher

Familiar.FlavourText: Entourage of the Arcanist. (Starfall Celebration Holiday Familiar 2013.)
Familiar.Name: Arcane Sprite

Familiar.FlavourText: This Hippalectryon emits a frigid aura.
Familiar.Name: Arctic Hippalectryon

Familiar.FlavourText: Thousands of years of evolution have granted this bat hardened armor to protect against falling magmatic debris.
Familiar.Name: Armored Duskflapper

Familiar.FlavourText: It is arguable whether the armor makes the owl more or less deadly. Without the armor their flight is nearly silent.
Familiar.Name: Armored Greatowl

Familiar.FlavourText: Adapted to filter feed in the scalding depths of Blacksand Annex. (Colored by PythtechGenetics.)
Familiar.Name: Ashen Bicorn Whale

Familiar.FlavourText: This particular variety of chimera only appears in areas of the Starfall Isles where Beastclans are active, leaving some to wonder if the Clans have a hand in their creation.
Familiar.Name: Ashmane Chimera

Familiar.FlavourText: You'd think that, as a serpent, having hooves would be a detriment. You'd be wrong.
Familiar.Name: Ashscale Ophiotaurus

Familiar.FlavourText: A gnarly, vicious land spider that is more at home on the cooled lava than you are. There is definitely reason for concern.
Familiar.Name: Ashspine Widow

Familiar.FlavourText: Dryads will attack dragons that attempt to cut or harvest any piece of their grove.
Familiar.Name: Aspen Gall Dryad

Familiar.FlavourText: Keeping an Augite creation in good working order involves semi-regular patching and allowing the creature long stretches of slumber.
Familiar.Name: Augite Protector

Familiar.FlavourText: The autumn dryad is often seen guiding local fauna to burrows or caves so that they are protected from the approaching colds of winter.
Familiar.Name: Autumn Dryad

Familiar.FlavourText: This variety of pangolin is known for a vibrant shift of color, each unique to the individual. (Colored by biskitten.)
Familiar.Name: Aurora Pangolin

Familiar.FlavourText: This shiny arthropod is a deft swimmer; it is quite a treat to see one swirling and twirling down a creek during the waning sunlight of autumn.
Familiar.Name: Autumn Millifae

Familiar.FlavourText: These creatures will conceal themselves among sea grasses, adding a touch of autumn color to underwater fields of green.
Familiar.Name: Autumn Sea Dragon

Familiar.FlavourText: Sure, 'collector's item' you might say. Might we suggest an axe that doesn't have teeth and eyeballs?
Familiar.Name: Axe Mimic

Familiar.FlavourText: Baku are able to walk both the physical and ethereal plane.
Familiar.Name: Baku

Familiar.FlavourText: A delightful, enchanted Bogsneak marionette. No strings attached!
Familiar.Name: Ball-Jointed Bogsneak

Familiar.FlavourText: Little is known about how the Bamboo Phytocat's physiology evolved, but one thing is for certain: watch the reeds as you walk.. (KS-sponsored by kiohl.)
Familiar.Name: Bamboo Phytocat

Familiar.FlavourText: The banded owlcat moves silently, both in the air and on the ground.
Familiar.Name: Banded Owlcat

Familiar.FlavourText: These animated guardians grow from fallen trees.
Familiar.Name: Barkback Boar

Familiar.FlavourText: Always thrilled to play, this bright canine is the perfect distraction for a lair full of tireless hatchlings. (Colored by Cynderbark.)
Familiar.Name: Barking Jester

Familiar.FlavourText: It's not unheard of for dryads to form alliances with nature dragon clans.
Familiar.Name: Barkskin Watcher
